intro: Micromeria parviflora f. rubrotincta, commonly known as the red-stained micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the citrus family, Rutaceae, and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The foliage is typically evergreen, with narrow, leathery leaves that have a distinctive aromatic scent. This variety is distinguished by its reddish tinge on the stems and leaves, which gives it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in arid landscapes.
